page.title: 01Profile Rednal Shropshire
page.content: Queens Head straight mile is a Roman road where some excavation has taken place. The road leads to Rednal aerodrome used in the 1939 - 45 war used for industry. Here there are seven small factories. The most controversial being a maggot factory. Lower Hadley and Wordsley are small hamlets with no new building permission. All the above are in the electoral division of West Felton and children attend West Felton Primary School. Decoy Farm is approached over an unmanned crossing on the main Wolverhampton/Chester railway line and is in the Whittington electoral division. Children attend Whittington C.E. aided school. Land is used for grazing and cultivation except Bagley Marsh and moor which are wet lands interesting to botanists.
